Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
I stole this from medium atricle:
```
1. Private key
A private key is essentially a randomly generated, 32-byte number.

2. Public key
A public key can be derived from the private key using what‚Äôs called Elliptic Curve Cryptography. 

3. Public address
Public key ‚Üí 8-step process involving concatenation, hash functions (SHA-256 and RIPEMD-160), and Base58Check ‚Üí public address```
